moves.1. d4: Dmitry opens up with a queen's pawn game.
moves.1... d5: I respond d7-d5 because I don't like to give up the center position
moves.5... exd5: I take with pawn to prevent e4.
moves.6. Bg5: bishop to pin my knight on f6
moves.6... c6: c6 to prevent queen to a4
moves.7. Qb3: Dmitry decides to scare off my annoying bishop
moves.7... Bxc3+: I decided to take because I don't want to waste tempo
moves.8... h6: My turn to scare away the annoying bishop=)
moves.9. Bxf6: interesting....instead of moving bishop to h4 Dmitry decides to take my knight.
moves.9... Qxf6: of course I would take with queen.
moves.10. e3 Nd7 11. c4: pawn to c4 seems like Dmitry wants to get his bishop to attack mode.
moves.11... dxc4: I take his gambit since I know I can scare his bishop off the next move.
moves.13... Be6: bishop to e6, forcing Dmitry's queen off his sweet position.
moves.14. Qc2 O-O: time to get my king to safety.
moves.15... Rfd8: moving my rook to an open file directly facing vertical towards his bishop.
moves.16... Nd7: me trying to take his strong outpost away
moves.17. f4: Dmitry pushes pawn to double protect knight.
moves.17... Nxe5: I of course take since I wanted Dmitry to have a doubled up and backwards pawn.
moves.18. fxe5: Dmitry takes with fpawn opening up the file for his rook to attack my queen.
moves.19... Rac8: me moving the rook to try to open up the c file
moves.20... c5: c5 applying pressure on d4 pawn and bishop at d3.
moves.21. Bb1: Dmitry decides to move his bishop to a safe position.
moves.21... cxd4: well for me a draw is like a win, time to do some trading here.
moves.22. exd4 Rxc1 23. Rxc1 Rd7: rook to d7 protecting the 7th rank..this is the move I thought about a long time.
moves.24. Qc2: mwahahaha sneaky Dmitry wants to go to h7
moves.24... g6 25. Qd2: trying to me my pawns up
moves.25... Kg7: time to get on the defense side.
moves.26. Be4 b6: not giving him any room to attack my pieces
moves.27. Rf1: Dmitry sees the weak pawn lever.
moves.27... Bd5: better for me to trade off his strong bishop
moves.28. Bb1: He really likes his bishop haha.
moves.28... Bb7 29. Qf2: applying more pressure at the f6 square.
moves.29... Rc7: give my rook some opening room yay.
moves.30... Qe6: now its the matter of playing defensive.
moves.31. h3 Qe7: not moving my queen anywhere, not falling for any traps.
moves.32... Qe6: I'll just stick with my plan.
moves.33. Qd2 Bd5: what about moving my bishop can't forget my cutie. And after this move I offered him a draw. And surprisingly he accepts it.

gameName: Lowell High School Simul Exhibition Match with IM Dmitry Zilberstein
players: IM Dmitry Zilberstein  vs. Anthony Li
